intro: Malvastrum parishii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Malvastrum parishii is also known for its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves.
